message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with the problem of sparse signal recovery from compressively sampled measurements using weighted $\ell_1$-minimization. This is a problem that is studied in several areas of computer science, including information theory (cs.IT), signal processing (cs.SP), machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), and multimedia (cs.MM). Given that the paper focuses on the recovery conditions and guarantees of the method, it is most likely to belong to the information theory and signal processing categories. However, the inclusion of numerical experiments with real video data suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the computer vision and multimedia communities.
